meanings.definition: In a manner that is lacking in substance or interest.
meanings.sent1: The movie ended jejunely, leaving the audience bored.
meanings.sent2: She spoke jejunely, without any passion or excitement.
meanings.sent3: The party was jejunely decorated with only one balloon and a small cake.
meanings.sent4: His speech fell jejunely on the ears of the sleepy crowd.
meanings.sent5: The book's plot was so jejunely written that I couldn't finish it.

meanings.definition: In a way that is insipid or dull.
meanings.sent1: The food at the cafeteria tasted jejunely, lacking any flavor.
meanings.sent2: The presentation was delivered jejunely, putting everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The joke fell jejunely flat, eliciting no laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was jejunely colored, with no vibrant hues to catch the eye.
meanings.sent5: The music played jejunely in the background, barely noticeable.
